p: Chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine act either as viral entry blockers or as immunomodulators. Despite encouraging preliminary reports, side effects, and interactions with other medications are well known [55]. Chloroquine has potential interactions with commonly used drugs like ampicillin, amlodipine, azithromycin, propranolol, and antacids [56]. Chloroquine has significant drug interaction with ciclosporin as it increases levels of cyclosporin by decreasing its metabolism. Also, Chloroquine increases levels of tacrolimus by the same mechanism but to a lesser extent [56].
